title.native: ポケモンジェネレーションズ

description: Pokémon Generations looks back at each generation of the Pokémon video game series, diving into the stories of the games more deeply and getting to know characters and Pokémon better. Visit each region, from Kanto to Kalos, to relive the world of Pokémon like never before!

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

tags.name: Creature Taming
tags.description: Features the taming of animals, monsters, or other creatures.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Wilderness
tags.description: Predominantly features a location with little to no human activity, such as a deserted island, a jungle, or a snowy mountain range.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1584883706858074112) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=arifumi_imai) 

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Currently freelance, with strong ties to [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

While being an accomplished animator on [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793/) and [Sengoku Basara](https://anilist.co/anime/5355/), he gained notoriety as an Action Animation Director for [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/). Imai, together with Director [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088/), CG Director [Shuuhei Yabuta](https://anilist.co/staff/120824/), and fellow animator [Yasuyuki Ebara](https://anilist.co/staff/133640/), conceptualized how Attack on Titan's ODM gear should move in animation, and Imai himself storyboarded and animated many of its action set pieces. 

Married to [Hisako Akagi](https://anilist.co/staff/134516/).
He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1584883706858074112) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=arifumi_imai)

Married to [Hisako Akagi](https://anilist.co/staff/134516/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1584883706858074112) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=arifumi_imai) 

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Currently freelance, with strong ties to [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

While being an accomplished animator on [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793/) and [Sengoku Basara](https://anilist.co/anime/5355/), he gained notoriety as an Action Animation Director for [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/). Imai, together with Director [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088/), CG Director [Shuuhei Yabuta](https://anilist.co/staff/120824/), and fellow animator [Yasuyuki Ebara](https://anilist.co/staff/133640/), conceptualized how Attack on Titan's ODM gear should move in animation, and Imai himself storyboarded and animated many of its action set pieces. 

Married to [Hisako Akagi](https://anilist.co/staff/134516/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1584883706858074112) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=arifumi_imai) 

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Currently freelance, with strong ties to [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

While being an accomplished animator on [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793/) and [Sengoku Basara](https://anilist.co/anime/5355/), he gained notoriety as an Action Animation Director for [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/). Imai, together with Director [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088/), CG Director [Shuuhei Yabuta](https://anilist.co/staff/120824/), and fellow animator [Yasuyuki Ebara](https://anilist.co/staff/133640/), conceptualized how Attack on Titan's ODM gear should move in animation, and Imai himself storyboarded and animated many of its action set pieces. 

Married to [Hisako Akagi](https://anilist.co/staff/134516/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/後藤隆幸)

Co-founder and representative director of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). The studio is named after him and [Mitsuhisa Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103267/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bahijd) | [Tumblr](http://bahijd.tumblr.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bahijd)

Freelance animator from Austria who gained attraction on the internet thanks to his gif animations, which then served as a stepping stone for him joining the industry. Made his proper debut on [Shinichirou Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/)'s adaptation of [Kids on the Slope](https://anilist.co/anime/12531/). His cuts are often heavily layered, exploiting the unique potential of digital processing.

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Skullgirls (Video Game, 2012) (Character and Effects Animation)
- Carpainter - Digital Harakiri (Music Album, 2015) (Cover Illustration)
- Death Stranding (Video Game, 2019) (Concept Art)

Affiliated with [Studio Silver](https://anilist.co/studio/6240/). Older brother of [You Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/).

He is known for having reached great expertise in many techniques from realistic animation to digital compositing. This gives him the ability to have full control over his works, often being responsible for the key frames, in-betweens, finishing, photography and backgrounds of the scenes he is in charge of.

His skilled use of coloring and compositing, together with the realistic depiction of movement make his works to be often mistaken for computer generated animation.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Ghost in the Shell (Video Game, 1997) (OP Key Animation)
- Tales of Phantasia (Video Game, 1998) (Cutscene Director, Animation Director, Key Animation)
- Valkyrie Profile Series (Video Game, 1999-2008) (Character Design, Art Design) 
- Kafu ~Kono Shirabe ga Kimi ni Todokimasu You ni~ (Visual Novel, 2001) (OP Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography, CG Animation)
- Sakura Wars 3: Paris is Burning? (Video Game, 2001) (OP Key Animation, In-Between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography)
- Akiiro Renka (Visual Novel, 2005) (OP Director, Animation Character Design, Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography)
- Muv-Luv Alternative (Visual Novel, 2006) (Cutscene Mecha Design, Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography) !~
